negatives: The vanilla cream pie had chunks of ice
The scallops were spongy
positives: Good price @ Prix Fixe Tasting $35
The salad was fresh and the pasta was flavorful
The waiter & waitress were great
title: Bistro 7 Restaurant Review

children.text: Overall, this was a good restaurant. This was our first time here. We loved the service and the location. We had no problem finding parking. The biggest issue was the dessert. We could tell that it has been in the freezer for a long time.
Southern, Seasonal restaurant, where culinary excellence meets the heartwarming flavors of the South. Located in Charlotte, NC. - 3
rd & Fernwood

individualFoodRating.name: 3 Cheese Mac ($11)
individualFoodRating.review: Cheesy, goodness

individualFoodRating.name: Braised Greens ($8)

individualFoodRating.name: Dirty Rice Grits ($9)

individualFoodRating.review: Nice mixture of oxtail, veal & ground beef

individualFoodRating.name: Sweet Potato Bread Pudding ($9)
individualFoodRating.review: Nice end to the meal, wish it came with ice cream instead.

children.text: We recently had the pleasure of dining at 3rd & Fernwood and were thoroughly impressed. The food was not only delicious, but beautifully presented, making each dish a feast for the eyes as well as the palate. The service was top-notch; our server was friendly, attentive, and made us feel well-cared for throughout the evening. We also appreciated the clean and inviting atmosphere, which added to the overall enjoyment of our meal. While the prices were perhaps a tad higher than we'd typically prefer, the quality of the food and the overall experience more than justified the cost. We left feeling completely satisfied and are already planning our return visit. 3rd & Fernwood is a true gem and we highly recommend it to anyone seeking a memorable dining experience.

negatives: The restaurant is located in the casino & if you don't know about the entrance across the street, you will have to walk through the casino to access it.
The closest bathroom is downstairs in the casino.
There are slot machines lined on the opposite wall of the restaurant, emitting sounds that constantly remind you that you are in a casino.
positives: The Cioppino is delicious, comparable to the staple dish in San Francisco.
Nice staff, fast service. We arrive with no dinner reservation & were seated after a 15-minute wait.
Great views. The restaurant is over South Virginia Ave, where the Atlantis camera is. Great views of the mountains & cars whizzing on the road underneath.
title: Atlantis Sky Terrace Oyster Bar Review

children.text: We were pleasantly surprised to find such delicious seafood inland! The Cioppino was a standout, rivaling those we've had in San Francisco. Despite arriving without a reservation, we were seated quickly, and the service throughout our meal was friendly and efficient. The restaurant boasts fantastic views of the mountains and the bustling street below, thanks to its unique location over South Virginia Avenue.
However, finding the entrance proved a bit tricky, as it's tucked away across the street from the casino. Also, be aware that the closest restrooms require a trip downstairs to the casino level.

Ultimately, we enjoyed our meal and found the portions generous – splitting two appetizers and an entrée was perfect for us. While the casino setting might not be ideal for everyone, the quality of the food and the stunning views make it worth considering.
I was excited about Fourk's reopening after the closing news. However as a prior patron I was left feeling a bit underwhelmed.
I've been to the dinner service several times in the past & am not sure if today's experience was a change in the flow going forward or just the new team (day 3 of reopening) working things out.

The introductions started around 10 minutes late & were a bit rushed. While in prior dinners there was an eloquent & elaborate overview of the concept, the flow of the night & the meaning of the paintings on the wall, this most recent dinner was a tad curt & not as engaging as I have come to expect from the evening.

Alexis & her team were cordial but the evening did not exude the homey, communal atmosphere I equate to Fourk. I also found myself explaining the process to my dinner party as they had not been before, something that should have been covered in the intro. Lastly when dishes were cleared the team did not replenish missing cutlery which resulted in the team serving the 3rd course and walking away, unaware we had not way of eating it.
During introductions the chef seemed to struggle on describing what was on the menu for the night, an oddity in my mind. Shouldn't you know the intimate details of the dinner menu?
1st course: Panzanella Salad w/ Balsamic Vinaigrette (8/10) | Nice & fresh, great starter. I don't like capers & enjoyed them very much in this dish. The Salento pairing was nice & not over powering.

2nd course: Sesame-Ginger Ahi Tuna on a Crispy Wonton w/ Avocado Cream, Sriracha Aoli (9.25/10) | Best course of the night. The Chianti was a bit dry for my taste yet paired perfectly with the crispiness of the wontons & balances out the avocado cream & Aoli.

3rd course: Cola Braised Short Rib w/ Fried Shallota & Parmesan White Polenta (6/10) | Worst course of the night. While the polenta was creamy & the rib was tender, the dish came out tepid & was paired with a chilled Syrah which magnified that the gelatinous consistency of the almost cold dish. As the main course this was very disappointing.

4th course: Peach Cobbler w/ Vanilla Ice Cream & Bourbon Caramel Sauce (8/10) | The dessert course was good but I am not sure there was peach in it as it taste more akin of a coffee cake. The prosecco pairing was a bit odd at first but worked well.
Overall a subpar evening (expectation did not match reality). I will wait for the new team to iron out the small details before returning. Note the price increases to $64 (from $54) in September.

"Fourk was created by Executive Chef, Restaurateur and 24-year Military Veteran Paul Jansen. Paul started his culinary journey in 2015 when he left his corporate career of 14 years to start his successful wine bar & tapas concept Citizen Vine. Four years later Paul created Fourk Kitchen, a restaurant concept created to change the way people think about a four-course dining experience, which is usually expensive and sometimes intimidating." - Fourk

individualFoodRating.name: Cola Braised Short Rib w/ Polenta
Peach Cobbler w/ Vanilla Ice Cream

children.text: Overall a subpar evening (expectation did not match reality). I will wait for the new team to iron out the small details before returning. Note the price increases to $64 (from $54) in September (2024)

The Original Rinaldi's Deli and Cafe is a popular spot for sandwiches, salads, and breakfast in El Segundo and Los Angeles. They've been serving up delicious food for over 60 years, and their reputation for quality is well-deserved.

The sandwiches are the star of the show at Rinaldi's. They use fresh, high-quality ingredients, and their sandwiches are always made to order. The Italian combo is a classic choice, but there are plenty of other options to choose from, including the Reuben, the BLT, and the grilled chicken salad sandwich.

The salads are also very good at Rinaldi's. They're made with fresh ingredients, and they're tossed in a variety of dressings. The Cobb salad is a popular choice, but there are also other options to choose from, such as the Caesar salad and the Greek salad.
Rinaldi's also serves breakfast. Their breakfast sandwiches are made with fresh bagels, eggs, and cheese. They also have a variety of breakfast burritos and breakfast bowls to choose from.
The service at Rinaldi's is friendly and efficient. The staff is always happy to help you choose the perfect sandwich or salad, and they're always willing to make substitutions.
The prices at Rinaldi's are reasonable. Sandwiches start at around $7, and salads start at around $10.

Overall, The Original Rinaldi's Deli and Cafe is a great place to go for a delicious sandwich, salad, or breakfast. The food is fresh and high-quality, the service is friendly, and the prices are reasonable. I highly recommend it!

negatives: Limited hours: only open weekdays 7 - 3 pm, so if you are in the area outside that time, you will miss out.
positives: Walkable deli from Hyatt Regency LAX airport with great sandwiches & outdoor seating.
title: The Original Rinaldi's Deli and Cafe Restaurant Review

children.text: Great deli close to LAX hotel, with sandwiches & desserts available.

negatives: The bathroom is located down a set of stairs, an accessibility issue.
The 2-seater tables are a bit small & space can quickly be occupied with drinks, appetizers & cutlery.
positives: We came in without a reservation right before 5pm & were seated promptly. In the future, we would make a reservation, especially after 6pm and/or on the wekeend.
Karina, our waitress, was phenomenal. Genuine, personable & always anticipating our needs.
Food is amazing. Would make a trip out to Boston just to eat here again.
Bathroom is clean & there are plenty of stalls.
Branzino entree came with two sides, rather than a $3 - $5 charge per.
Hot hand towels were provided at the end of the meal.
title: Atlantic Fish Company Review

children.text: We stumbled upon Atlantic Fish Company just before the dinner rush and snagged a table, but we'd definitely recommend making a reservation, especially for later dining.
Our server, Karina, was an absolute gem! Attentive, friendly, and genuinely personable – she really elevated our experience.
And the food? Amazing! Seriously, we'd travel back to Boston just to savor those flavors again. The branzino was a highlight, and we loved that it came with two sides included.
A few minor observations: the tables for two are a bit cozy (read: small), and the bathroom is down a flight of stairs, which poses an accessibility issue.

But those are minor quibbles in an otherwise fantastic experience. Hot towels at the end of the meal were a lovely touch! Overall, Atlantic Fish Company is a must-try for seafood lovers in the Boston area. Highly recommend!
Hip setting for slurping Japanese noodle bowls & munching chicken wings with cocktails & sake bombs. -
Google

individualFoodRating.review: Decent portion size

individualFoodRating.name: Spicy Garlic Tonkotsu ($16)

negatives: The ramen broth came out tepid; wish it was warmer.
The Spicy Garlic Ramen special was very mild, with "spicy" in the name, definitely thought it would have more of a kick.
positives: Great location, close to hotels and malls.
While the hostess was a bit off-putting, our waitress Addison, was very personable.
We showed up around 5 pm on a Friday without a reservation & were seated promptly. Restaurant filled up rather quickly despite the sub zero weather.
The tables in the middle of the restaurant have hooks which we utilized to hang up our winter jackets.
Portion sizes were good, add ons were also reasonably priced.
title: RAMEN-SAN Deluxe Restaurant Review

children.text: We recently enjoyed a delicious ramen dinner at their  Deluxe location. Its central location, close to hotels and shopping, made it a great choice for a quick and satisfying meal. We were seated right away on a busy Friday night, and our server, Addison, was friendly and attentive. We appreciated the hooks at our table for our winter coats – a thoughtful touch in sub-zero weather!

We ordered the Karaage Chicken Nuggets, Roasted Edamame, Spicy Garlic Tonkotsu, and Tonkotsu ramen. The appetizers were excellent, and the ramen portions were generous with reasonably priced add-ons. However, we were a bit disappointed that the ramen broth was lukewarm, and the "spicy" garlic ramen wasn't very spicy at all.
Overall, we had a positive experience. The food was flavorful, the service was great, and the location was convenient. We recommend it when you are in Chicago and looking for a tasty ramen fix.
Chinese bistro for contemporary takes on Hong Kong dishes, matched by herb-infused cocktails. -
Tiger Fork

children.text: Make a reservation for weekend dinner.

We had a great experience at Tiger Fork DC. While the restaurant is tucked away in an alley, which made it a little tricky to find, the delicious food and drinks were well worth the effort. We started with the Salt & Pepper Calamari, which was perfectly crispy and seasoned. For our main course, we shared the Beef Brisket Chow Fun, and it was fantastic – flavorful with plenty of tender brisket.

We also enjoyed the creative cocktails. The Victoria Harbour was silky smooth and semisweet, while the Nathan Road was a bit stronger but still very enjoyable. The Chinese Kitchen, with its flaming cinnamon stick, was a fun and flavorful experience. The Monkey King Bread was a tasty dessert, though we would have preferred it a bit softer.

The service was friendly and attentive, and the ambiance was pleasant. While the location is a bit unusual, we appreciated the unique atmosphere. We'll definitely be back, especially for happy hour at the bar.
Kyu Miami Chef Tasting Dinner Menu ($95 pp)

We went to Kyu for my youngest sister's birthday. Located in Wynwood, the restaurant has a large inside dining area as well as several tables outside 4 under the building awning & more located in the street.

With our 615pm reservation, we were seated promptly outside at one of the four tables located right outside the main entrance. After being seated & greeted by our waitress, we asked if we could do the tasting menu due to our party's lactose intolerance. The waitress left to check with the kitchen & upon her return triumphantly announced we could indeed have the tasting menu.
The chef-tasting menu consists of 9 menu items listed as "Enjoy a delicious selection of Chef's favorite seasonal dishes, perfectly sized to your group. Let us do the hard work"

We had a few minutes before happy hour ended (at 630pm) and put in two orders of Old Fashioned (w/ George Dickle Rye) along with one Margarita with Olmeca Altos Plata Tequila. Each drink was $10 ($7 happy hour + $3 specialty upcharge).
We sipped on our drinks and chatted while we waited for the first dish to arrive.
1st course was Krunchy Kale ($9), which ranked 7th out of the 8 entrees for all of us. Overall this starter was okay & not something I would order again.
2nd course was Crispy Spicy Hamachi Tartare (21), which ranked 1st of the 8 entrees for my spouse & sister while ranking 2nd of the 8 entrees for me.

While I don't like meat tartare, I enjoy fish/seafood tartare. The crispy rice base was topped with wasabi mayo & the fish was the perfect mixture of crunchy, melty, sweet & spicy. I would definitely order this entree again.
3rd course was Roasted Cauliflower ($20), which ranked 5th and 6th for my spouse & sister respectively while ranking 4th for me.

Upon setting the entree down, we were instructed to cut up the cauliflower & mix it with the herb vinaigrette. The kitchen placed the goat cheese on the side, rather than underneath the cauliflower for our lactose intolerance, which we greatly appreciated. I loved this entree and would definitely order it again.

4th course was Crispy Pork Belly ($17, which ranked 5th for my sister & me while ranking 6th for my spouse. While the pork belly was nice & tender,  I personally did not like the bun. It was "mushy" and not as sweet as expected.
5th course was Thai Fried Rice Stone Pot w/ egg ($25), which ranked 3rd for my spouse & sister, while ranked 6th for me.

The entree came with table-side preparation, where the waiter mixed all the ingredients together & portioned it out in silver bowls. My spouse & sister thoroughly enjoyed this meal, however, the rice, to me, tasted like the burnt rice you find at the bottom of the pot & I felt it needed a bit more, something. I would be interested in trying this entree with the king crab option, to see if the crab provides that special something I was looking for.
The 6th course was Beef Short Ribs ($45), which ranked 2nd for my sister, 3rd for me & 4th for my spouse.

When the entree was set, we were instructed to squeeze the lime over the meat. The meat was tender, and the contrast of the sauce with the lime was delectable. The sweet soy and garlic soy were so good, my sister refused to wipe the sauce from her hands and saved it for the last lick. This was a flavorsome entree I will think about until my next trip to Kyu Miami.
The 7th course was Grilled Bok Choy ($11), which we all agreed ranked 8th of the entrees. I love bok choy, however, this entree needed to be cooked a bit longer as the stem was tough.
Less than a minute after the bok choy was placed on the table, the 8th course of Wagyu Beef Brisket ($49) arrived. This ranked 1st for me, 2nd for my spouse, and 4th for my sister.
The kitchen's instruction was to make lettuce wraps with the meat, sides, spices & sauces provided. The meat melted in your mouth & was a great "end" to the meal.
The 9th course was Tropical Fruits ($10) which was brought out with "Happy Birthday" written in chocolate on the plate, along with a candle.
Entree Rankings:
Sister:
Tartare
Ribs
Fried Rice
Brisket
Buns
Cauliflower
Kale
Bok Choy
Spouse:
Tartare
Brisket

Self:

Ribs
Cauliflower
Buns
Fried Rice
Kale
Bok Choy
Overall the $95 per person tasting menu was an unforgettable experience. Next time, I will order the brisket, the ribs & either the cauliflower or the tartare to share, to spare my wallet.
KYU brings a fresh concept to Miami, the wood-fired Asian grill features a diverse menu and focuses on professional yet relaxed service and a commitment to green practices.

negatives: Pricepoint. Granted we were in Miami & prices are on the high side, the $95 per person price tag was a bit excessive. Next time I will order 2 of my favorite dishes to share with my dinner companions.
positives: Great food was served by a great staff.
title: KYU Miami Restaurant Review

children.text: Made a reservation at Kyu Miami to celebrate my sister's birthday. Great food & great staff made for a memorable night with my loved ones.
" It's Moist! It's Crispy! It's Delicious!" -
Jong-Ro Chicken

negatives: This is nitpicking: we wished there was an option to sample more than 2 flavors with one "fried chicken" order.

When we arrived Sunday around 530pm, the parking lot was pretty empty. When we left 30 minutes later cars were circling the lot looking for a space, likely due to the number of restaurants located in the plaza.
positives: Staff went above & beyond for our take-out order. They updated us frequently about the wait time. They even offered us glasses of water as we waited.
We ordered the half & half chicken (original and sweet chili). For $25 it was more than enough chicken to share.
The restaurant was 3 miles from the strip (a negative for some). It was easy to get to & there was plenty of parking.
title: Jong-Ro Chicken Restaurant Review

children.text: Jong-Ro Chicken was a fantastic find! We initially planned to try a different fried chicken spot, but we're so glad we stumbled upon this place instead. The staff went above and beyond for our takeout order, keeping us updated on the wait time and even offering us water while we waited. We ordered the half-and-half chicken (original and sweet chili), and for $25, it was more than enough for two. The chicken itself was delicious – crispy, flavorful, and cooked to perfection.

The restaurant is located about 3 miles from the Strip, which might be a drawback for some, but we found it easily accessible with plenty of parking. If we had to nitpick, we'd say it would be nice to have an option to sample more than two flavors in one order. Also, the parking lot got surprisingly busy while we were there, so be prepared for a potential wait for a spot. Overall, we were incredibly impressed with Jong-Ro Chicken and can't wait to return.
Hip counter-serve offering imaginative donuts & creative renditions of fried chicken. -
Astro Doughnuts & Fried Chicken

children.text: The donuts run out quickly. It's best to order early via the website.

We always enjoy the fried chicken at Astro. They also have a variety of donuts with interesting flavor combinations, with the Maple Bacon and Key Lime Pie donuts being our favorites. While some donuts weren't as impressive, we had a positive experience overall. We recommend ordering donuts online as they tend to sell out. A minor drawback was the cleanliness, which could be improved.
After we explored the Denver Zoo & Denver Museum of Nature & Science for five hours, we walked one mile through City Park to have dinner at Mono Mono Korean Fried Chicken.
Upon entering there was 1 waitress at the bar who instructed us to sit anywhere we liked.
After picking the only wet table in the restaurant, we picked a different table/booth combination against the back wall before settling in (aka removing cold weather layers.)

On the walk over, we decided to order so when the waitress came, after we were settled, by with waters, we promptly ordered Combo B, "mild", 86 the slaw, instead subbing for an extra piece of Texas toast.

During our Wednesday night visit, there were two other occupied tables: a table of two on the same wall of booths/table combos as well as a family of three in the middle booth. During our visit, these were the only 3 occupied tables. As we were leaving several more patrons entered the restaurant

While we waited for our food, we visited the bathroom to wash our hands, noting that it was stocked and relatively clean. Albeit noting both paper hand towels and toilet paper were set on the back of the toilet, rather than in their respective wall unit holders.

Our food arrived 20 minutes after we went to the bathroom, so around 25 minutes after ordering and we immediately asked for a to-go box, don't be fooled Combo B is a plethora of food. We portioned half of the food (chicken) in the to-go boxes and began to tackle the mountain of fries (cold fries are a "no-go")
I was surprised at how good all the food was, my favorite was the teriyaki soy followed closely by the saucy popcorn chicken.
Service was good, the one waitress managed the three tables well, ensuring we each had everything we needed. She was always within earshot if anything came up during our meal.
One negative was that I asked for a cup of hot water (to make a cup of tea) and she stated they did not have water (even at the bar) but could ask the kitchen to boil a cup for me, which I declined.
Overall a great experience, with great food at a very reasonable price.

"Korean-style fried chicken uses an Asian frying technique that renders out the fat in the skin, transforming it into a thin, crackly, and almost transparent crust. With more than 20 years of chef experience, Mono Mono Korean Fried Chicken was brought to Colorado by long-time prolific restauranteur JW Lee with the goal of introducing new cuisine to the Denver area." -
Mono Mono KFC

negatives: No hot water is available to make a cup of tea
positives: Great price, so much food for $39!
Good service, the waitress during our visit was prompt & courteous.
The food came out hot & was cooked perfectly. The sauces on the side were a great compliment to the meal.
title: Mono Mono Korean Fried Chicken Review

children.text: At $39 (plus tax) who would say "no" to Combo B
@monomonokfc

?

Half Sauce / Half Dry
Choice of Mild or SPICY (chose Mild)
6 pc. Teriyaki Soy
2 pc. Drumsticks
3 pc. Tenderloin
Saucy Popcorn Chicken
Fries
Double toast (no slaw)

It was all delicious, definitely will return.

The first night after check-in (4 pm), we headed downstairs to dinner. We were seated immediately outside, next to a nice, cozy fire. Dinner was divine: the chicken thighs ($23) were cooked perfectly & the sauce complimented the meal well. The calamari ($26) was different & the least favorite of the meal. We added prawns ($9) to the flat iron ( $28). While both were good, wished we were given more than 6 prawns.

The following morning around 11 am we went downstairs for lunch. While we were seated immediately the patio was packed & service was a bit slower than the night before. Similar to dinner, lunch was delicious. The soup ($4) was a bit small yet tasty. The Shore Room (TSR) Burger ($16) was delicious with crispy, crunchy fries.
Our final meal was our go-to breakfast: french toast ($14) with a side of eggs ($3) & bacon ($4) along with chicken fried steak ($21).
A delicious end to a delicious trio of meals at The Shore Room. Definitely, a great place to eat in Reno.

negatives: Prices from our October 2020 stay have increased, with a decrease in the portion size.
The TSR burger is $2 cheaper at lunch than dinner, with nothing added to the meal.
Service, while good, is inconsistent
positives: Great food: tasty food served in large portions
Reasonable prices
Great service: staff is friendly & service was prompt.
Great location in downtown Reno, overlooking the river
Great location in downtown Reno, overlooking the river
title: The Shore Restaurant Review

children.text: This is our go-to restaurant for breakfast/brunch when we want delicious French toast & chicken fried steak. We spent two nights in the attached hotel & ate 3 meals in the Shore Room.

children.text: Breakfast will be the best meal here.

title: The Rooftop by STK In Room Dining Review

children.text: We recently tried the in-room dining at this hotel, and while it had its moments, it was a bit of a mixed bag. We were pleased with the quick service – our food arrived in under 30 minutes. The Banana Crunch Pancakes and Matcha Latte were definite highlights, both delicious and well-prepared.

However, we were disappointed with the inconsistency in the food quality. The Andaz Eggs were overpriced for the small portion, and the chicken wings were downright inedible. We also noticed discrepancies between the menu in our room and the prices we were charged, which was frustrating.

While the Tropical Greens Smoothie, Chicken and Waffles, and latte were decent, they weren't anything to write home about. Overall, we'd say this spot is okay for a quick and convenient breakfast if you're staying at the hotel, but we wouldn't go out of our way to eat here. And we recommend steering clear of the chicken wings.

, a vibrant cocktail menu, and a relaxed atmosphere perfect for unwinding above the city skyline. 🍸 #MrStorkSG #RooftopViews #AndazSingapore

I reached out to the staff who stated that the drink I ordered (off the menu) was no longer available & which is why they charged more for the customization. The staff removed the $27 charge.
positives:
The sharing platter ($68) is a great price to have a variety of food options
• Mr. Stork Sliders ($22)
• Crispy Prawn Wonton ($25)
• K-Pop Chicken ($22)
• Pizzette Margherita ($20)
• Signature Truffle & Seaweed Fries ($22)

Staff is very gracious. We did not have a reservation on a weekend & they were able to seat us. As the sun was setting, we asked to move under the shade & they graciously moved our table into the shade.
World of Hyatt Members offered a 10% discount, which we had to ask for applied to the bill.

children.text: Visiting Mr. Stork in the late afternoon?  It can get quite hot between 5 PM - 6 PM, so opt for shadier seating away from the edge to stay cool while still enjoying the stunning views!

title: Mr Stork, Singapore Food Review

children.text: We were staying at the
Andaz Singapore (review here

) and wanted to try some of their restaurants. We visited, sans reservation, during our weekend stay with the intent of sampling both food and happy hour beverages. Great food with great service marred by unrelenting direct sunlight. Would definitely visit again, opting for post-sunset dining experience.
Inspired by the bright and vivacious colors that can be found on almost every island in the Caribbean. Indulge in traditional Caribbean cuisine & culture.  -
Jasmine's Caribbean Cuisine

individualFoodRating.name: Codfish Fritters
individualFoodRating.review: We prefer the traditional Jamaican version on this appetizer, hover this was good.

individualFoodRating.name: Oxtail
individualFoodRating.review: Well seasoned  and cooked. Meat was falling off the bone.

individualFoodRating.name: Plantains
individualFoodRating.review: These were nice and soft

individualFoodRating.name: Coco Breeze
individualFoodRating.review: Great taste and had lot of Alcohol.

individualFoodRating.name: Scandal Rum Punch
individualFoodRating.review: Not too sweet like others that I've had. Thats a good thing in my book.

children.text: The restaurant is very small so we recommended that you make a  reservation.

We had a delightful dining experience at Jasmine's Caribbean Cuisine. The atmosphere was warm and inviting, with a nice "Jamaican vibe." The staff was friendly and attentive, and the service was prompt.

We started with the Codfish Fritters, which were a bit different from what we're used to, but still tasty. The oxtail, however, was absolutely divine! The meat was fall-off-the-bone tender and perfectly seasoned. The plantains were also a hit, soft and flavorful.
The drinks were a highlight. We enjoyed the Coco Breeze and Scandal Rum Punch, both of which were refreshing and flavorful.

While the food was delicious, we did find the portions a bit small, especially for the oxtail. Also, the restaurant is quite small, so we recommend making a reservation to avoid a long wait. Overall, though, we had a great experience and would definitely return to try other items on the menu.

negatives: Parking is a common issue in the Midtown area.

Sunday special of buy one get one 50% off is a good deal. Note you have to buy the same size for both in order to use the deal.
A sink in between bathrooms allows for seamless hand-washing access.
Tasty food, good prices & nice overall experience.

children.text: Check their social media for deals and plan to arrive a few minutes before opening to get a table.

title: Cosmo's Snack Bar Restaurant Review

children.text: After checking social media & learning about Cosmo's Sunday BOGO 50% off, we decided to try them out. Arriving promptly at 355 pm (they open at 4 pm) allows for the first choice of seating in the intimate dining room. We picked a table near the entrance to the back patio & then promptly went to the counter to order. Overall we had a great experience & would definitely return in the future.

negatives: Pricey burgers ($15) that don't come with fries, can order for $4.
Service was a bit slow. For NYC's fast-paced lifestyle, this restaurant's staff had little sense of urgency. We were seated at 5:04 and received the check at 6:41.
positives: Small NYC restaurant with available outdoor seating. They have a speakeasy as well, that had great drinks.

The food was good, ordered the buffalo wings ($10), the Garfunkel ($16), and the Lower Eastsider ($16) with a side of tater tots ($10). The drinks were great, ordered the 8 Ball ($13) & Reyes Rush ($13).
title: The Burgary Restaurant Review

children.text: This small NYC restaurant had a lot going for it: a convenient location near our hotel, outdoor seating, and an enticing speakeasy. We enjoyed the buffalo wings and both burgers we ordered (the Garfunkel and the Lower Eastsider), though we were surprised that fries weren't included considering the $15 price tag. The tater tots and cocktails were delicious, but the service was unfortunately slow. Even by relaxed standards, waiting over an hour and a half for a fairly simple meal felt excessive. Overall, the food and drinks were good, but the slow service and price point left us feeling a bit underwhelmed. With so many other options in the Lower East Side, we'd probably explore those before returning here.

individualFoodRating.name: Ponto Pancakes ($18)
individualFoodRating.review: Ask for a side of miso caramel

individualFoodRating.name: Chicken Sandwich ($23)
individualFoodRating.review: Add a side of egg to take this to another level

children.text: Our visit to Vaga blew us away. Every dish we tried was delicious, especially the Ponto Pancakes – that miso caramel was a game changer. The Chicken Sandwich was also fantastic, and adding an egg took it to the next level. Beyond the amazing food, the presentation was beautiful, the service was friendly and attentive, and the whole place felt clean and inviting. Honestly, we can't wait to go back and try more of the menu. It's become a new favorite spot for us.

Forget the fancy tea sets—this is brunch, reimagined! Take a delicious trip around the world as five acclaimed chefs craft dishes inspired by the flavors and rich traditions of global tea culture. From dim sum and oolong to chai-spiced bites, Moroccan mint tea pairings, British tea-time classics and more, this walk-around brunch is steeped in bold flavors and creative pairings—the perfect sip to match every bite.

Enjoy tea-inspired cocktails and hand-selected teas from across the globe, guided by a tea sommelier who will pair each chef’s dish with complementary sips—highlighting the nuance, complexity, and culinary connection of tea beyond the cup. and taste how tea has shaped culinary traditions far beyond the cup. Whether you’re here for the matcha martinis, fragrant warmth of masala chai, or cool refreshing Moroccan mint tea, this brunch is your passport to the world of teatime.
Join us for a global celebration of tea, taste, and tradition in one unforgettable brunch experience! -
Hawai'i Foor and Wine Festival
GENERAL ADMISSION COST: $125

location: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort and Spa
title: MatCHA Chai Brunch | Hawaii Food and Wine Festival

children.text: After we explored the Denver Zoo & Denver Museum of Nature & Science for five hours, we walked one mile through City Park to have dinner at Mono Mono Korean Fried Chicken.
Upon entering there was 1 waitress at the bar who instructed us to sit anywhere we liked.
After picking the only wet table in the restaurant, we picked a different table/booth combination against the back wall before settling in (aka removing cold weather layers.)

On the walk over, we decided to order so when the waitress came, after we were settled, by with waters, we promptly ordered Combo B, "mild", 86 the slaw, instead subbing for an extra piece of Texas toast.

During our Wednesday night visit, there were two other occupied tables: a table of two on the same wall of booths/table combos as well as a family of three in the middle booth. During our visit, these were the only 3 occupied tables. As we were leaving several more patrons entered the restaurant

While we waited for our food, we visited the bathroom to wash our hands, noting that it was stocked and relatively clean. Albeit noting both paper hand towels and toilet paper were set on the back of the toilet, rather than in their respective wall unit holders.

Our food arrived 20 minutes after we went to the bathroom, so around 25 minutes after ordering and we immediately asked for a to-go box, don't be fooled Combo B is a plethora of food. We portioned half of the food (chicken) in the to-go boxes and began to tackle the mountain of fries (cold fries are a "no-go")
I was surprised at how good all the food was, my favorite was the teriyaki soy followed closely by the saucy popcorn chicken.
Service was good, the one waitress managed the three tables well, ensuring we each had everything we needed. She was always within earshot if anything came up during our meal.
One negative was that I asked for a cup of hot water (to make a cup of tea) and she stated they did not have water (even at the bar) but could ask the kitchen to boil a cup for me, which I declined.
Overall a great experience, with great food at a very reasonable price.

"Korean-style fried chicken uses an Asian frying technique that renders out the fat in the skin, transforming it into a thin, crackly, and almost transparent crust. With more than 20 years of chef experience, Mono Mono Korean Fried Chicken was brought to Colorado by long-time prolific restauranteur JW Lee with the goal of introducing new cuisine to the Denver area." -
Mono Mono KFC

negatives: No hot water is available to make a cup of tea
positives: Great price, so much food for $39!
Good service, the waitress during our visit was prompt & courteous.
The food came out hot & was cooked perfectly. The sauces on the side were a great compliment to the meal.
title: Mono Mono Korean Fried Chicken Review

is a Modern Neighborhood Brasserie from the people who brought you the Peaches Family of Restaurants
"Contemporary restaurant in the ARIA Resort & Casino serving Taiwanese fare & specialty dumplings." - Din Tai Fung

negatives: Located on the casino floor of the Aria Hotel, it was a feat to navigate the throngs of people in the smoked-filled casino to get to the restaurant.

We showed up without a reservation & were told there was no availability. We made a reservation for the next day at the hostess stand. When we walked away we checked the website & were able to make a reservation for 45 minutes later. Wish the hostess informed us of this opening instead of stating there was no seating available for the remainder of the day.
We placed our total food order at once, which caused all the food to come out in quick succession. Next time we will space out the food ordering.
For the price, the portion size could have been a bit bigger.
positives:
Food was delicious. 
Ordered the
• Baby Back Ribs $13.50
• Crab PK XLB $13
• Shrimp Spicy Wontons $16.50
• Pork Buns $9
• Braised Beef Noodle Soup $19.50
• Pork Chop Fried Rice $20.50
• Jasmine Tea $6
• Mango Green Tea $6.50
Staff was attentive & courteous.
The jasmine tea was the best I have ever had. Appreciated that the tea carafe was left at the table, so we were able to enjoy hot tea throughout the meal.
title: Din Tai Fung Restaurant Review

children.text: Din Tai Fung at the Aria in Las Vegas was a delicious dining experience. The food was incredible; we especially loved the Baby Back Ribs, Crab PK XLB, and Shrimp Spicy Wontons. The service was also top-notch, with attentive and courteous staff who made us feel well-cared for. The jasmine tea was the best I've ever had – the fact that they left the carafe at our table so we could enjoy hot tea throughout the meal was a lovely touch.

However, getting to the restaurant proved to be a bit of an adventure, as it's located on the casino floor, and we had to navigate through crowds and smoke to get there. We also had a slight hiccup with the hostess who told us there were no reservations available, but we were able to snag one online just 45 minutes later.

Finally, while the food was amazing, the portion sizes felt a bit small for the price. We also learned that ordering all our food at once meant it arrived in rapid succession, so next time, we'll space out our orders. Despite these minor points, we had an amazing evening at Din Tai Fung and would definitely return.

children.text: This place was a real find. We loved the generous portions, friendly staff, and convenient location close to our hotel and the beach. The prices were also very reasonable for the area. We enjoyed everything we ordered, especially the Chili Lime Wings, Fried Chicken, and Chicken & Honey Mustard Salad. The Lab Cadillac cocktail was a standout too, perfectly made with a delicious tajin rim.

While the service was generally good, it did slow down a bit during peak hours, which is understandable. Our only real disappointment was the Seafood Linguini. It was tasty, but we expected a heartier dish with more seafood, given the price. Overall, though, we had a great experience. This spot offers good food, good portions, great prices, and good service. We'll visit again on our next trip to Oceanside.
